alert.note: Alert for Bell; Harlan (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 01 at 6:13PM EST by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Harlan and southeastern Bell Counties through 645 PM EST... At 612 PM EST, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from Rosspoint to near Hutch. Movement was east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Harlan, Loyall, Rosspoint, Coxton, Golden Ash, Ages, Kitts, Clovertown, Harlan Gas and Verda around 615 PM EST. Evarts, Putney, Bailey Creek, Darkmont, Short Town, Kildav and Kenvir around 620 PM EST. Nolansburg, Shields, Highsplint, Colts, Dizney, Black Mountain and Pathfork around 625 PM EST. Louellen, Black Bottom, Lejunior, Hensley Store, Closplint, Clover-Darby and Liggett around 630 PM EST. Other locations in the path of these storms include Peepace Store, Martins Fork, Holmes Mill, Mary Alice, Lynch, Smith, Clover, Martins Fork Lake, Three Point, Rock House, Bobs Creek, Clover Fork, Cranks, Crummies and Big Black Mountain. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
